channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London's Trendiest Office Space - Lead and Mid-Level Perl Developer roles
item.description: I love working in a vibrant, modern space. If youâ€™re going to spend all day at work, it might as well be somewhere you enjoy being, rather than a cubicle farm. This client has a workspace Iâ€™m actively jealous of!

item.title: Be a trailblazer in a time of growth - Full Stack Architect required for a rapidly expanding London company
item.description: We recently started to advertise a developer role at a financial services company thatâ€™s growing in a bamboo-like fashion. We can now confirm that theyâ€™re also looking for some top talent to help lead this expansion. If youâ€™re currently a senior full stack developer looking to take on your next role as an architect then this is a great opportunity to do so in a company that is both ambitious and supportive. Increased job satisfaction is another perk, as their codebase is notably new and clean and the team are committed to using modern practices.

item.title: Fancy an all-inclusive trip to The Perl Conference next year*?
item.description: I attend a lot of Perl conferences and itâ€™s always interesting to see which employers are well-represented with a lot of delegates and which employers have little or no presence. This company is up there among the most prominently represented at a number of the European conferences, and shows a real commitment to staying at the cutting edge of Perl. In-house, the focus on training and development continues with a strong mentorship programme â€“ a large number of their Senior Developers started there in Junior roles.

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop
item.description: September 7-8, 2018 Bern.

item.title: Nordic Perl Workshop and MojoConf 2018
item.description: September 6-7, 2018, Oslo.

item.title: The Perl Conference in Europe
item.description: August 15-17, 2018, Glasgow. The Call for Papers is open.

item.title: NLPW - Dutch Perl Workshop 2018
item.description: July 7, 2018, Arnhem, The Netherlands

item.title: The Perl Conference in North America
item.description: June 17-22, 2018, Salt Lake City.

item.title: French Perl Workshop
item.description: May 18-19, 2018, Paris.

item.title: A decade of classes in Lausanne
item.description: May 14-18, 2018, Lausanne. Five training classes by Damian.

item.title: My report of the Perl Toolchain Summit 2018 in Oslo
item.description: Sometimes, sitting together and talking about things can get things done much more efficiently.

item.title: A Perl Toolchain Summit 2018 organiserâ€™s report
NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: A practical guide to testing in Modern Perl
item.description: The beginning of a new book by Viacheslav Tykhanovskyi and Gregor Goldbach. Only 5% is ready and only 4 readers so far, but the subject is important - I was thinking about writing about it myself - so give it a try. There is a 45-day money-back guarantee for every book on LeanPub.

item.title: Forging Python
item.description: An excellent book for Python developers with tons of recommendations that are not language specific. Besides, this is the only Python book I read that had positive comments about Perl, Larry Wall and Audrey Tang.

item.title: 2018.18 Releases Galore
item.description: The weekly dose of Perl 6

item.title: Strings in Perl: quoted, interpolated and escaped
Using a queue in Perl
item.description: Queues are one of the fundamental data structures in the programming world. Here is an example using Perl.

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: April 3rd-30th
item.description: Perl 5.24.4, 5.26.2, and 5.27.11 are now available.

item.title: Maintaining Perl 5 (Tony Cook): March 2018 Grant Report
RFC: 100 PDL Exercises (ported from numpy)
item.description: PDL is the Perl Data Language for Scientific computing with Perl. numpy is the Python library for matrix calculations.

item.title: How long does it take you to learn a new language?
item.description: 2 months for Perl and Mojolicious

item.title: Out of memory!
item.description: What really happens if your process tries to use more memory than is available in the computer? An experiment.

item.title: Swish-e documentation
item.description: The original swish-e.org site is no more, but the source code is available on GitHub. and the documentation is available to browse here on dezi.org.. Swish-e is Simple Web Indexing System for Humans.

item.title: C, Golang, Perl, and Unix
item.description: An excellent look into what fork() and exec() do, What are STDIN, STDOUT, and STDERR. Some exploitation ideas and some bizarre bugs.

item.title: XS utility routines that are good to know
item.description: XS is the language that can glue Perl and C together. David covers some useful routines for common cases you'll encounter when programming in XS. The areas he covers are: Scheduling XS code to run at startup. Handling tied variables. Unicode tools.

item.title: Baby Moose
item.description: John has another set of articles, now about Moose. I wonder how can he keep up the daily posts and how does he find all the cute images that come with the posts. I was hoping he'd have a post about his posts. Every one of us could learn from him and generate more interesting content.

item.title: Call for Venue for the Perl Conference in Europe 2019
item.description: Would you like to host a Perl Conference in your town? This is you opportunity to organize one!

item.title: Introducing CI/CD, Test Automation to your team
item.description: Besides editing the Perl Weekly newsletter and writing articles on the Perl Maven site, I also offer services to companies helping them improve their development practices. Primarily I help introducing Test Automation systems (Unit ~, Integration ~, Acceptance tests.) Setting up CI/CD systems. Virtualization. Cloudification. Almost all of my clients came through referrals by people like you. Members of the Perl community. So if your team or company is interested in such a move, you know where to find me.

item.title: #354 - PDL - Perl Data Language
item.description:
Hi there,

I am heading to Budapest today to visit the Craft Conf. A fun event with lots of great presentations and tons of food.

I hope to see some of you there!

Enjoy your week!
